results.title: Thru the mirror
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Mickey Mouse falls asleep reading Lewis Carroll’s ‘Alice Through the Looking Glass’ and dreams himself into wonderland. Features Mickey in 1930’s dance routine. Notable for virtuoso Disney animation techniques, anticipating the design and devices used in the later feature version of Alice in Wonderland.

results.title: Thrownness
results.brief_description:
Two people are thrown into a strange, mysterious place where nothing is as it appears to be and where the relation between cause and effect is never stable. As they explore their surroundings they discover that space, time and themselves are elements of a carefully constructed illusion. Thrownness has been inspired by Matthew Arnold’s poem, ‘Dover Beach’ and philosopher Martin Heidegger. Arnold’s poem of 1867 has surprising contemporary relevance in a time where ‘ignorant armies clash by night’. The romantic photography reminiscent of 1950 Technicolor films, fantastical sets inspired by Fellini’s films and the use of old style in-camera effects create an intriguing, magical aesthetic.

As viewers Thrownness asks us to consider our role in creating narrative coherence through our understanding of cinematic traditions and visual language. The story has an integral, essential and evolving relationship with the elements that create it. The effect of this is the generation of an unexpected alternative narrative which reveals the complex artifice that is the film language.

results.title: Thrown away
results.brief_description:
A man contemplates suicide in a public lavatory cubicle. An unseen figure enters the space and proceeds to carry out the exact sequence ofevents that have bought the man to this critical moment. Is somebody playing a trick on him, or is this his doppelganger? Alarm turns to curiosity and he decides to investigate.
Written, directed and edited by Dan Thomas and featuring Christopher Hatherall as the man.

results.title: Throwing in baseball
results.brief_description: Shows the ins and outs of throwing a baseball following all the procedures of how to “throw” with technique and practice. Takes the viewer through “throwing practice” with its secrets on pitching the “perfect curve ball”.

results.title: Throwing and catching
results.creator_credit: N.E. Sweglar and Visual Information Systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lacrosse - the Fastest Game on Two Feet”
A coaching film concentrating on how one holds the lacrosse stick and the correct way to throw and catch the ball. Also shows exercises to help you and your team develop your skills.

results.title: Throwing
results.creator_credit: Richard Philps and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Potter”
This film deals exclusively with the use of the potter’s wheel and explains the principles of centring. Various methods of making simple shapes such as a beaker or mug, a jug, a bowl, a dish and a bottle are also illustrated.

results.title: Throw Momma from the train
results.creator_credit: Danny DeVito, Larry Brezner and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Larry Donner (Billy Crystal) is not happy. His ex-wife has stolen his novel, reaping the financial rewards and giving Larry a serious case of writer’s block. To complicate matters Owen (Danny De Vito), a student in Larry’s creative writing class wants to participate in a murder-swap; Larry’s wife for Owen’s mother. This eventuates after Larry recommends Owen sees Hitchcock’s ‘Strangers on a train’ to assist in his writing. Owen misinterprets his intentions, taking the film literally. It seems like a simple task but killing Momma isn’t that easy! Written by Stu Silver.

results.title: Through the years
results.creator_credit: Marita Kent, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite being diagnosed with Turner’s Syndrome, Marita Kent was determined to live a normal life. Looking back over the years, Kent has much to be proud and happy about.

results.title: Through the wire
results.brief_description: In 2002, in amongst raging protests and police reinforcements, more than 40 refugees, rendered desperate by manditory detention, escaped from Woomera Detention Centre in South Australia. Narrated by escaped refugee DJ Moopsie, with powerful music by Mark Daniel, ‘Through the wire’ captures the heightened emotions, despair and desperation of the day and takes us inside the minds of those imprisoned trying to seek a better life.
